philosophy.title: High Modularity Design
philosophy.subtitle: A lesson from electronics history
philosophy.description: The consumer electronics industry abandoned modularity for cheaper production. But infrastructure has different requirements - an EV charger must last 15+ years and be serviceable in the field. We're bringing back the modular approach, enhanced with modern technology.

history.title: Service Evolution: The TV Example
history.subtitle: How the industry lost repairability - and why we're bringing it back

era1.title: Modular Systems
era1.description: A TV set consisted of a chassis and replaceable modules: tuner, IF, video, audio, power supply. Each module had its function and could be independently replaced or repaired.
features: Fault? Diagnosis in 5 minutes - which module is bad
Module swap in the field in 30 minutes
Module goes to workshop - repaired without rush
Technician doesn't need to be expert in all modules

era2.title: Integrated Systems
era2.description: All functions in a few custom chips on one board. Cheaper to manufacture, but impossible to repair. Surface-mount components, proprietary parts, planned obsolescence.
features: Service often more expensive than new device
"Throw away and buy new" - 3-5 year lifespan

era3.title: ELEKTROKOMBINACIJA
era3.description: We combine the best of both worlds: highly modular design enabling fast field replacement, with modern AI diagnostics that predict failures and robotic automation for swap.
features: No technician needed in the field
Module is repaired at service center - by humans
era3.result: 15+ year lifespan, zero downtime, circular economy

team.title: Our Vision
team.subtitle: Return to modularity
team.mission: The industry went down the integration path - everything in one chip, impossible to repair, planned obsolescence. But infrastructure isn't a phone. An EV charger should last 15+ years. We combine 1970s modularity with 2020s AI technology: module swap in the field in 60 seconds, no technician needed, and AI predicts failures two weeks ahead.
